quizzes.question: What tags are used to indicate headings?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]HTML Headings[/h1] HTML includes six levels of headings, which are ranked according to importance. These are [b]

[/b], [b]

[/b], [b]

[/b], [b]

[/b], [b]

[/b], and [b]
[/b]. The following code defines all of the headings: [code format="html" codeId="10"] first page [b]

[/b]This is heading 1[b]

[/b] [b]

[/b]This is heading 2[b]

[/b] [b]

[/b]This is heading 3[b]

[/b] [b]

[/b]This is heading 4[b]

[/b] [b]
[/b]This is heading 5[b]
[/b] [b]
[/b]This is heading 6[b]
[/b] [/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2532" width="100%"] [note]It is not recommended that you use headings just to make the text big or bold, because search engines use headings to index the web page structure and content.[/note]

quizzes.question: How do you create a horizontal line in HTML?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Horizontal Lines[/h1] To create a horizontal line, use the [b]
[/b] tag. [code format="html" codeId="11"] first page

This is heading 1

This is heading 2

This is heading 3

This is heading 4

This is heading 5
This is heading 6

This is a paragraph

[b]
[/b]

This is a paragraph

[/code] [b]Result: [/b] [img id="2533" width="100%"]

[h1]Comments[/h1] The browser does not display comments, but they help document the HTML and add descriptions, reminders, and other notes. [code format="html" ][b][/b][/code] [b]Example:[/b][code format="html" codeId="12"] first page

This is a paragraph

This is a paragraph

[b] [/b] [/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2534" width="100%"] As you can see, the comment is not displayed in the browser. [note]There is an exclamation point (!) in the opening tag, but not in the closing tag.[/note]
